If you right clic on the account the pop up shows an option to "New Folder" on account1 I have used this feature to create many additional folders into which I move eMails I want to keep and to organize my work flow.

When I create account2 on the same eMail provider (rogers) in this case, all of those created folders are duplicated from account1 onto the new account2

This only seems to happen when adding a second email account on an existing eMail provider.

I have signed on to the rogers web email site for account2 (which is actually Yahoo Mail) and verified that these extra folders DO NOT already exist.

I have also created both of these accounts on my phone (A Samsung S25) using Samsung eMail and the folders were not duplicated to account 2.

So, that points me back to Thunderbird as the culprit.

content:
re :Thunderbird 145. That means you are using the 'Thunderbird Release' channel as it is currently offering version 145.0 It is the official 'monthly release'. This release is intended for users who want all available new features and bug fixes on a monthly basis.

There is also the 'Thunderbird Extended Support Release' channel currently offering the 140.5.0esr It is the official annual extended support release. This release is intended for users who want all available new features on an annual basis and stability/security fixes on a monthly basis. So you do not get all the new features so quickly, just the security and bug fixes.

That means you have chosen to use a product which offers all the newest features, some you may like, others may not be so important. But it does mean you may be using addons that are not as up to date. After all they are not Thunderbird employees, they are just users like you and me who created an addon and offer it to others who hopefully would offer a donation to help maintain it.

It would be helpful to know if you use any addons and if yes, the name of those addons.

You can find a quick list to copy and paste here:

  • Help > TRoubleshooting Information
  • scroll down to 'Add-ons' section
  • Either post an image or use copy paste to post info.

Have you performed the basic test by restarting Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode? If no, then please do this first and then try to drag and drop an attachment to desktop. Please report on results.

I am assuming that you have fully downloaded the email and the attachment. Do you use IMAP or POP account ? Are you using an any addons such as Conversations ?

content:
Probabilmente nella tua rubrica hai associato il nome di questo mittente all'indirizzo di un provider PEC. Dovrebbe bastare cancellare il mittente dalla rubrica:

La PEC nel sistema italiano è una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST è mediata dal una società abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremo quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST. Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato è che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di". Per risolvere il problema è necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica.

content:
HI Terry.

I'd like to make sure that I understand.

  1. You receive a new message.
  2. "1" appears on the taskbar and tray icon.
  3. As Thunderbird receives more new messages when you are not using Thunderbird, that "1" is incremented, apparently with an accurate count of new messages.

But then, what do you mean by "when I actually download the new emails"? Do you have Thunderbird set to download only headers? Then, when you must select the messages to see the bodies?

And what do you mean by "still only 1"? You said that the counter was incremented. Do you mean to say that after you select the messages to download the bodies, the counter reverts to "1"?

If I understand correctly, then almost all that makes sense. When you select the messages to download the bodies, they are no longer new. They may remain unread for some time, depending on how long you have set Thunderbird to wait before considering a message read.

I understand that the taskbar and tray icon can show the count of either new messages or unread messages. See my screen image. I can imagine that you have them set to show new messages and that the counter is behaving as it should. The only mystery would be why "1" still appears in the badge. Is there still a new message somewhere?

But I may not be understanding your situation perfectly.
creator: mozilla98

content:
re: If I then search for that email it is found and points to the inbox, but doesn't appear in that list.

That's just the Global database which is not up to date or you have not compacted the Inbox recently. The email does not exist in the Thunderbird IMAP account because it does not exist on server. How may this have occurred ?

Your mail account in Thunderbird must have been set up as an IMAP mail account which means it can only display whatever is on the server. All folders in an Imap account synchronise with all folders of same name on server. That's the same view as if you had logged onto your webmail account via a browser.

You phone has a mail account accessing the same email address on same server. However, if you have set up a mail account on phone that uses the POP protocol, then the default setting would be to access only server 'Inbox' and download mail and delete copy off server. You need to check the account settings on phone to see if you can select an option to 'Leave copy on server' OR the only alternative is to remove the Pop account on phone and recreate it as IMAP.

But remember, when using an IMAP protocol, if you delete any email from the phone then it will synchronise with server and delete off server which means when you log on to Thunderbird account, that same email will get removed because it does not exist on server.

Are you seeing passwords for the other accounts when you scroll down?

The passwords are not to the right. There is only one column for passwords. There are two ways to show more on the screen:

In any case, what do you ultimately need? Have you forgotten a password? You probably know that you can re-set your password at the server.

content: Calendar is built into every current version of TB, so references to Lightning are obsolete. TB supports CalDAV and CardDAV (syncing of network calendars and contacts), except MS calendars and contacts require the TbSync/Provider for Exchange ActiveSync add-ons. Google calendars and contacts are supported with the built-in options, except tasks require the Provider for Google add-on.
creator: sfhowes

content: For the outgoing server, use STARTTLS security on port 587. If it still times out, it might be caused by a mail-scanning antivirus, especially if it's not Windows Security.
creator: sfhowes

content:
I am unclear on what you are asking. Here are the steps I always suggest, and most users report success, although it's easy to overlook details, which are important.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer, started once and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it 
#   start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: The LOCAL is not necessary. Thunderbird can work with only one profile. It sometimes accumulates many, but they're just baggage. The inaccessible message happens if the desired profile and associated profiles.ini are not loaded together. The purpose of using the thunderbird folder and not the profile folder is that the thunderbird folder includes both. Here is what happens: thunderbird opens the profiles.ini but the profile it is identifying isn't there. That can be an easy fix, often by overtying in the profiles.ini the actual location. this is avoided when the thunderbird folder overwrites the default thunderbird folder. what often happens is the user pastes the transferred thunderbird folder to the appdata\roaming]\thunderbird folder which creates appdata\roaming\thunderbird\thunderbird - and that is why I state that a prompt to overwrite should happen.
creator: davidsk
